alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 10:20PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Monmouth and south central Middlesex Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1020 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Freehold, or 13 miles west of Asbury Park, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Highlands, Farmingdale, East Freehold, Robertsville, West Freehold, Adelphia, Yorketown, Elberon, Navesink and Collingwood Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 26 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 98 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
